intro: Gnaphalium pichleri, commonly known as the Alpine feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its slender stems and feathery foliage give it a delicate appearance, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium pichleri is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in marginal environments.
